link.synopsis: One of the most successful alternative bands in the world, Coldplay have come a long way from their inception in London during the late 1990s to their rapid climb to rock superstardom. This unauthorized biography offers an in-depth exploration of the U.K.-based quartet -- composed of Chris Martin, Will Champion, Guy Berryman and Jonny Buckland -- and the tumultuous early days of the first recordings.

link.synopsis: Beginning with Hitler's invasion of Poland in 1939, World War II would grow to become one of the most influential conflicts of the modern age. Roland is a ruthless bounty hunter, and Oliver has antibodies in his blood that render him impermeable to the plague that's devastating the world's population. Although Oliver is killed, his girlfriend (Barbara Cranston) is carrying his baby, and that unborn child could hold the key to saving the world.

But when chief inspector Al Brodsky (Kenneth Welsh) and detective Lou Miles (John Kapelos) rule the death a suicide, reporter Vidal (Tony Nardi) investigates and discovers that Miles is hiding some big secrets. Michael Moriarty, Patti LuPone and Gloria Reuben co-star.

link.synopsis: In 1989, University of Utah chemists Drs. Martin Fleischmann and Stanley Pons made one of the greatest and most controversial scientific discoveries of our time. The two claimed that a cell filled with water and fitted with a palladium electrode produced enough power to deduce that the energy source must be nuclear. This fascinating documentary explores the controversy surrounding cold fusion and its viability as a clean energy source.

link.synopsis: A man makes a mistake he'll regret for the rest of his life when he hits on a woman at a bus terminal in Javier Barbera's thriller. When Robert (Juan Sola) spies Greta, he wastes no time and quickly engages her in a flirty conversation. The pair leaves the bus station for a more intimate setting, but Robert's one-night stand turns into a nightmare when he discovers the sexy stranger is a killer with a deadly secret. Anna Lluch also stars.
link.title: synopsis
Crimson Rivers 2: Angels of the Apocalypse
The Hitcher II: I've Been Waiting
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

link.synopsis: Engaged to marry Denise (Chenoa Maxwell) in three weeks, real estate agent Rick (Rahsan-Rahsan Lindsay) begins to have cold feet. Those doubts increase when his brother takes him out for a night with the guys. Meanwhile, Denise begins to have misgivings of her own when a wedding planning meeting turns into a male-bashing session. When the couple's qualms evolve into a major crisis, they finally begin to face the realities of love and commitment.
link.title: synopsis
In the Line of Duty: The FBI Murders
Sex and the City: The Movie
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: Overcome with an inexplicable rage, an otherwise happily married man (Barnes Walker III) murders his wife in cold blood and flees to his sister's abandoned farm, where he plans to hide out from the police -- and, to some extent, from himself. But soon after arriving, he realizes he's anything but alone, receiving visits from curious locals, his wife's angry ghost and her suspicious lover, who's come to investigate her death.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Four brothers, each lonely and alienated, reunite after their father commits suicide by drowning himself in the frigid ocean. Although the siblings don't get along, they begin to grow closer as they deal with their loss and discover new information about their father's life. Director Tom Brandau based this film on his real-life experiences after his own father's suicide.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle
Dorothy L. Sayers Mysteries: Gaudy Night
The Deep End of the Ocean

link.synopsis: Rutger Hauer stars as Blondi, a German pilot hired by drug dealers to smuggle a hoard of cash out of the country who instead double-crosses them, keeps the money and flees with the beautiful Corinna (Vera Tschechowa). But the drug lords are hot on their trail and out for blood. Can Blondi and Corinna elude their pursuers, or is it already too late? This gripping thriller, recommended for mature audiences, also stars Horst Frank and Günther Stoll.

link.synopsis: Dissatisfied with his 9-to-5 job and his predictable suburban existence, 20-something Chicagoan Chris Payton (Chris Fountain) lurches into a life crisis that threatens to break up his marriage in this drama about the decision to take charge or give up. Chris's growing frustration eventually boils over, creating major friction with his wife. With his marriage in serious jeopardy, Chris must come to terms with what he wants for his future.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Jemma Redgrave stars as Inspector Eve Granger in two "Cold Blood" thrillers. In "Inside the Mind of a Killer," Eve turns to Jake Osbourne (John Hannah), a former boyfriend and convicted killer, to help her communicate with jailed murderer Brian Wicklow (Matthew Kelly). Wicklow's reign of terror continues in "The Killer Is Out for Revenge," when he targets a fellow inmate for death, leaving Eve and Jake racing to save the intended victim.

Edge of Darkness: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: Upon breaking his leg, a snowboarder and his four friends find themselves stranded at a decrepit ski lodge in the Norwegian mountains in this thriller from Roar Uthaug. After learning that the hotel was closed long ago when a boy vanished, the group discovers they are not alone and they'll be lucky to stay alive, let alone return home. The chiller stars Ingrid Bolsø Berdal, Rolf Kristian Larsen, Tomas Alf Larsen, Endre Martin Midtstigen and Viktoria Winge.
link.title: synopsis
Stranded: I've Come from a Plane That Crashed on the Mountains

link.synopsis: In her debut feature, Norwegian director Eva Sørhaug presents a thought-provoking character study of modern-day Oslo through the eyes of strangers whose lives are subtly intertwined. Christer (Aksel Hennie) lives hand to mouth while Turid (Birgitte Victoria Svendsen) clings to her waning youth. The sheltered Leni (Ane Dahl Torp) is terrified of people, and Heidi (Pia Tjelta) is preoccupied with her fractured love life.
link.title: synopsis
Perfume: The Story of a Murderer

link.synopsis: Aspiring DJ Pete (Michael Begley) reluctantly takes a job selling vacuum cleaners door to door so that his stripper girlfriend can pay her rent. Hating every minute of the job, Pete gets pointers from expert salesman Tommy (Timothy Spall), who applies seedy tactics to make his sales -- which only adds to Pete's uneasy feelings. This made-for-television release from director Danny Boyle first aired on the less conservative airwaves in Britain.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Rounding up some of belly dancer Cory Zamora's most memorable moments over the past few decades, this visually arresting program is a fascinating record of her talents. The collection includes a demonstration of veil ties such as "The Scarf," "The Duchess" and "My Tie"; a drum solo with Michael Beach and the Brothers of the Baladi; a solo performance from Zamora at her 55th birthday party; and a hip-shaking duet with belly dancer G.G.

link.synopsis: When peasant Tom Canty (Mark Lester) meets the Prince of Wales (also Lester), the two are dumbfounded by their resemblance and, on a lark, they trade places. But their prank has unforeseen consequences after the king unexpectedly passes away. This lavish adaptation of Mark Twain's The Prince and the Pauper comes vividly to life thanks to an all-star cast that includes Charlton Heston, Rex Harrison, Oliver Reed and Raquel Welch.

link.synopsis: In Europe at the dawn of World War II, aging performer Dan Scott (Keith Carradine) is past his prime. He finds renewed success singing in a cabaret act and eventually discovers love with a beautiful young girl (Mia Kershner) who lives nearby. link.synopsis: Shortly after Soviet dictator Joseph Stalin's death in 1953, Lavrenty Beria, an all-powerful interior minister, granted a broad amnesty. Suddenly freed and left on their own recognizance were hardened criminals who should never have been let out of their prison cells. It's a cold summer indeed when a pack of these ruffians invade a small village where two amnestied political prisoners are waiting for the arrival of a boat.

link.synopsis: A man (Duane Espinoza) confronts his abusive father, triggering a psychotic break from reality that eventually lands him in the desert in the company of a beautiful woman (April Shepherd) and her jealous lover. The man's descent into insanity, as he loses control of his thoughts and actions, leads to a shocking murder. But that's not the worst of it; the person who ends up dead provides an even bigger shock!

Evil Breed: The Legend of Samhain

link.synopsis: In 1942, cranky British ambulance driver Captain Anson (John Mills) -- who has an affinity for alcohol -- escapes Libya and must transport his passengers to safety in Alexandria, where he dreams of downing an ice-cold beer. His human cargo includes two stranded nurses (Sylvia Syms and Diane Clare) and a South African officer (Anthony Quayle). But as their destination nears, Anson discreetly deduces that someone in the vehicle is a German spy.
link.title: synopsis
The Battle of the River Plate
The Bridge on the River Kwai

link.synopsis: "Stone Cold" Steve Austin -- aka the Texas Rattlesnake -- dominated professional wrestling for more than a decade. This frank documentary profiles the man behind the muscle, traveling to England to talk to his daughters and to Edna, Texas, to explore his roots. The result is an intimate portrait of the notoriously private mat man as seen through the eyes of family and friends. Also included are clips of Austin in action in the ring.

link.synopsis: Set in Washington Heights, East New York and the Dominican Republic, this drama depicts four lost individuals who struggle to survive in the world of drug dealing and the street violence that surrounds it. Director Eddy Duran weaves a tale about a deadly incident that forever changes the lives of a narcoleptic artist, a down-and-out fighter, an alcoholic and an ex-convict. Aida Angotti, Onix Duran, Eric Leffler and Eric Molina star.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: On a one-way mission to a distant mining planet, pilot John Barton (Bill Campbell) is shocked to discover a beautiful woman named Lee (Poppy Montgomery) hiding on his one-man spacecraft. Ordered to dispose of his newfound stowaway, Barton's forced to make a life-altering decision. Directed by Peter Geiger, this memorable thriller blends spine-tingling sci-fi adventure with an intense, thought-provoking character study.
link.title: synopsis
Kiss Me Quick / House on Bare Mountain
Space: Above and Beyond: The Complete Series
The Dark Side of the Moon
Mom and Dad Save the World

link.synopsis: Vice cops John Dark (Luke Goss) and Mort Shade (Kevin Howarth) keep coming up snake eyes in their attempts to bust the architects behind a human smuggling ring. Everything changes, though, after Mort inexplicably becomes endowed with extraordinary powers, allowing the partners to bypass the judicial system and lay waste to perps. But Dark begins to question their methods as Mort gradually morphs into an unearthly species in this gory thriller.
link.title: synopsis
Jolly Roger: Massacre at Cutter's Cove
Ancient Evil 2: Guardian of the Underworld
Exorcism: The Possession of Gail Bowers
Death Bed: The Bed That Eats

link.synopsis: After hearing a cellmate talk about $10,000 kept in the home safe of Kansas rancher Herb Clutter, Dick Hickock (Anthony Edwards) and Perry Smith (Eric Roberts) break into the house to steal the money. The pair turns violent when they can't find the safe, killing the entire family and fleeing to Mexico. It takes Detective Alvin Dewey (Sam Neill) years to break the case and bring the men to justice. Based on the non-fiction book by Truman Capote.
link.title: synopsis
Ann Rule Presents: The Stranger Beside Me
In the Line of Duty: The FBI Murders
The Incredible Journey of Mary Bryant
See No Evil: The Story of the Moors Murders

link.synopsis: In this psychological thriller produced for French TV, a single mother (Sarah Grappin) lacking in maternal instincts, and a police detective (Nathalie Richard) desperate to conceive her own child, find their lives intertwined. When the mother abandons her child to pursue a love affair with a young female thief, the detective becomes obsessed with finding her. The suspense builds throughout in this taut drama from Jacques Maillot.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: They don't come much more hard-boiled than Jude (Kelly Lynch), a jewel thief who pushes her partner and lover, Ned (David Caruso), out of the getaway car and makes off with the plunder in this neo-noir thriller from John Ridley. Ned spends the rest of the film in pursuit of his lady and his loot -- a task made more difficult by the sexy hitchhiker (Stacey Dash) who begs a ride, tells a sob story and then turns a gun on him.
link.title: synopsis
Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead

link.synopsis: Disaffected teen Carla (Amanda Pays) goes on holiday with her father (George Segal) to East Berlin, only to discover a concealed "cold room" behind the wall in her hotel room that links her to the country's disturbing Nazi past. Is Carla communicating with a girl from another era, or is she just losing her mind? Written and directed by James Dearden, this moody thriller also stars Anthony Higgins and Renée Soutendijk.
link.title: synopsis
Timerider: The Adventure of Lyle Swann
Trancers 2: The Return of Jack Deth
S. Darko: A Donnie Darko Tale

link.synopsis: After five of her friends die violently on Norway's Jotunheimen mountain range, lone survivor Jannicke (Ingrid Bols Berdal) treks back to civilization, where her hospital stay is interrupted by the arrival of a new patient: the mountain man who killed her friends. Snowbound terror ensues in this tense sequel to the 2006 Norwegian slasher treat. Marthe Snorresdotter Rovik, Mats Eldoen and Kim Wifladt co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
In the Arms of My Enemy

link.synopsis: This poetic documentary captures environmental activist Sebastian Copeland's grueling two-month trek on foot to the North Pole, a tour de force of human perseverance commemorating Admiral Robert Peary's 1909 expedition. The film observes Copeland and partner Keith Heger as they prepare, reflect and finally set out alone on the 400-mile trip, their every step driving home the point that in another 100 years, the snow beneath will be gone.

link.synopsis: Wanna-be rocker Johnny (Greg Pritikin) may finally be headed somewhere when his manager tells him a deal is in the works with a recording company. Aiming to please his girlfriend (Jackie Katzman), Johnny invites her to move in with him and his porn-addicted roommate, Wiley (Gary Rosen), and hopes that good times are just around the bend. But when a contract fails to materialize and Wiley starts hitting on him, Johnny's life becomes more complex.

link.synopsis: Catch some insane snowmobile riding by the world's top sledders in this power-packed film shot on location in Alaska and Canada. Featuring a rock soundtrack and incredible camera work -- including heart-pounding shots from a head cam -- Off the Chain showcases the talents of Dan Phillips, Ross Mercer, Christoph von Alvensleben, Dane Ferguson, Randy Sherman, Jay Quinlan, Heath Frisbee, Tommy Frankson and more as they go big in the backcountry.

Highlights include a record-breaking jump and a freestyle competition. link.synopsis: In this offbeat early-'60s indie, blas burlesque dancer Iris Hartford (Lola Albright) ravishes 17-year-old neighbor Vito Perugino (Scott Marlowe), but the roles reverse when the working-class boy discovers that Iris is not the actress she pretended to be. It's a sexual awakening for both, with Iris head over heels like never before, Vito a quick study and Papa Perugino (Joe De Santis) advising caution, but time will tell who's zooming who.
